messages: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:20): does someone maintain a summary of Web Socket changes since -75?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:22): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: what was the last one that was basically Hixie's creation?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:23): I can't remember how much IETFness was in 76 vs. 75
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:23): actually hixie's latest is called "-latest" and didn't go into ietf
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:23): -latest sounds more Living than numbered snapshots :-)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:24): which had changed framing and a few other fixes (subprotocol negotiation comes to mind)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:24): but -76 was what got implemented, basically
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:24): ok, so is there a summary of the delta between -76 and whatever it is that's being implemented now?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:25): (opera has a few things from -latest that we had whined about and implemented before hixie got around to fixing the spec)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:25): not that i'm aware of
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:25): i would summarize it as follows: everything is changed
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:26): That's what I was going to say :)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:26): It is basically unrecognisable
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:26): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: did the IETF add or remove features in addition to changing how the old features mapped to bits on the wire?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:27): added "extensibility", binary support, compression support
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:27): actually i don't recall the state of compression
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:27): might be taken out currently
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:28): also made lots of details undefined
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:29): like error handling
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:29): see http://www.ietf.org/mail-archive/web/hybi/current/msg07063.html
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:32): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: leaving error handling details undefined is seriously uncool. Sad to learn that that happened. :-(
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:32): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: what does extensibility do?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:33): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: the framing has reserved bits for anyone to claim special behavior for, aiui
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:33): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: and there's a header to enable the extension or something
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:33): although extensions do not need to use the reserved bits (e.g. compression doesn't)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:35): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: please complain on hybi about undefined error handling
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:35): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: as far as i can tell everyone else on hybi seems to think it's cool
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:35): more or less
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:40): reminds me that i still need to review the newest spec changes
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:44): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: oh also close frames have status codes
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:00): tries not to get involved in hybi
9dfea2f9bd9114520591dceb20d528a1 (18:24): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: But I hope someone is getting involved, so it doesn't just run wild
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:30): 9dfea2f9bd9114520591dceb20d528a1: That policy failed
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:31): AFAICT the only browser people involve are Ian Fette from Google and Patrick McManus from Mozilla
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:32): Notably these are not the people who have been involved with WHATWG / recent W3C work
9dfea2f9bd9114520591dceb20d528a1 (18:38): So the plan is just to hope it doesn't run too wild? :)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:39): I don't think ther is a plan
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (18:40): yeah i don't know what to do really when it comes to updating our impl
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (18:40): i guess i will need to reverse engineer mozilla and chrome
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (18:41): yay for having a spec
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (18:43): i also hope somebody will push for simplifying the extension mechanism
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (18:44): or removing it
